results.title: Hope Street (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: East West Films and Ivan Hexter
results.brief_description: Homelessness is a major dilemma for many young Australians. Through the experiences of several young characters living in a refuge, caravan park and squat, Hope Street explores the reasons for their homelessness, the impact it has on their lives and the ways in which these young people endeavour to resolve their predicaments.

results.title: Hope is not a method. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Cites and describes seven contraceptive methods with anatomiclaly explicit diagrams. States the advantages and disadvantages of withdrawal, rhythm, spermicidal chemicals, the condom, the diaphragm, the pill, the IUD and sterilization. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hope is not a method
results.brief_description: The purpose of this film is to convey and illustrate the various methods of birth control. Seven types of contraception, in addition to vasectomy and tubal ligation are illustrated by means of animation and live action.

results.title: Hope for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film documents what was, for its time, a revolutionary breakthrough in occupational therapy - the pursuit of simple industrial vocation in sheltered workshops. A range of Victorian sheltered workshops are surveyed, and the filmmakers are keen to promote the greater satisfaction afforded their subjects by work which is both financially rewarding and socially useful.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and State Film Centre of Victoria

results.title: Hoop dreams
results.brief_description: For Phillip Murray basketball is more than just a game, it’s an escape, it’s his life, it’s his passion. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Koorie Heritage Trust Inc.

results.title: Hooked
results.brief_description: A number of narcotic addicts talk about their experiences and feelings, describing how they became addicted and how the habit affected their lives.

results.title: Hook, line and sinker
results.creator_credit: Andrew Rice, Esso Film Unit and Roy Layzell
results.brief_description: A description of the trip made by a new type of line fishing vessel on her maiden voyage to northern waters. Demonstrates the modern equipment of the Scottish-built ship with its refrigeration, line hauling tackle and diesel engine and brings out the skill and efficiency of the crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Rice, Esso Film Unit and Roy Layzell

results.title: Hong Kong: wandering with Rick
results.brief_description: With Rick we take a ferry-boat across Repulse Bay and catch a cable car up Victoria Peak for a panoramic view of Hong Kong. We ride a sampan from a fishing village, visit the busy docks of Hong Kong harbour and enjoy a rick-shaw ride through crowqded city streets.
